intro: Fimbristylis simulans, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This plant typically grows in moist, often swampy habitats, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. Fimbristylis simulans produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are often clustered at the ends of its stems. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality.
